fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • A graphic showing the activity of peers described Lord Paul as a crossbench peer; he is non-affiliated (The House of Lords in numbers, 31 May, page 13). • An article said “22 members of the cabinet who had not served in the armed forces were sent military decorations packaged with white features, traditional symbols of cowardice”. White feathers symbolise cowardice (Veterans hand back medals in protest over prosecutions, 31 May, page 26). • Other recently corrected articles include: I want to extend the lease on my flat, but the freeholders won’t help Edinburgh festival fringe to ‘break records for internationalism’ The lame show: why has David Letterman become so bad at interviews?
